name: Shrieker
lore: A shrieker is an ambulatory fungus that emits a piercing shriek when it detects light or movement nearby. The shriek serves as an alarm, alerting nearby creatures to the presence of intruders. Shriekers are often found growing alongside violet fungi and other dangerous subterranean organisms.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.description: If the shrieker is motionless at the start of combat, it has Advantage on its Initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the shrieker move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the shrieker is animate.

reactions.name: Shriek
reactions.description: The shrieker emits a shriek audible within 300 feet of it. The shrieker continues to shriek until the disturbance moves out of range and for 1d4 of the shrieker's turns afterward.
reactions.trigger: A creature or a source of Bright Light moves to within 30 feet of the shrieker.
